file_content.text: I am pro--pro--programmed against my will to direct you to the turbolift. Farewell, friend.
Wel--wel--welcome back. My master is awaiting you on the holo....
I was able to monitor some of your progress. You've put the Empire in full panic mode. They're reeling from the damage you inflicted.
We've put an end to their plans on Nar Shaddaa, but they'll be back.
The threat is over, for now.
The Empire is already threatening more of our people. This attack stirred things up.
I would've preferred to resolve matters without taking lives, but the enemy left us no choice.
I regret violence was needed.
The Empire doesn't share your aversion to killing. We're not done here.
No reason to stop now. Still got plenty of ammo.
Let's keep it up.
You'll need it, but not here.
If you managed to record my amazing heroics, I wouldn't mind a copy. For sentimental reasons, of course.
Do you have any footage of me?
I destroyed every holocam down there before it could record your face. This isn't over.
Sending messages from Imperial Intelligence headquarters is a big risk.
Are you safe where you are?
No choice. We've got a new problem that can't wait.
Nobody needs a pat on the back from you. Are we done here?
Stop being a suck-up.
The Empire's surprise attack is officially canceled, but we've got new problems.
I recently discovered a hidden annex of the Empire's Shadow Town prison complex. When I alerted SIS, they sent teams to investigate.
The Empire's keeping Republic POWs in the annex. Your attack threw the Imperials into a frenzy. They're about to execute our people.
We have to stop the executions. How do we get inside this prison annex?
Those monsters!
I can get you there easily from where you are. This droid has supplies you'll need to take with you.
Why would the Empire keep Republic prisoners on Nar Shaddaa? Are these soldiers who fought in the war?
Who are these POWs?
We've been fighting in the shadows ever since the Treaty of Coruscant. These POWs are spies and saboteurs.
I've been to Shadow Town. Those people are as good as dead.
There's nothing we can do.
No, we can save them. These prisoners haven't been fitted with cranial bombs yet. SIS agents are already moving to free them.
I need you to infiltrate the prison annex. Get our people out of there. This droid has supplies our agents will need.
Deliver the supplies to one of my remote droid units, and it will... oh... oh, no... Imperial Intelligence is on to me.
Are you sure you're not just being paranoid?
Don't panic.
I thought you said you could avoid detection.
What? How?
Paranoia is a survival trait in this business. Trouble is, it works both ways.
You're transmitting from inside their headquarters. It was only a matter of time.
That isn't exactly a surprise.
If they'd identified me, I'd already be dead.
I've been slicing my superior's private logs. His latest entries are all about hunting for a mole inside his division.
After everything that's happened today, I have to be one of his prime suspects. What do I do?
Don't wait to be discovered. He'll kill you--or worse. You've served the Republic well. It's time to come home.
Run for it.
Slip out quietly. Get off Nar Shaddaa as fast as you can.
Blast... there was so much more I could do here, but you're right. I'll use the chaos to cover my escape.
He doesn't know it's you, so there must be other suspects. Get him alone and take him out.
Kill him and get creative.
Make it look like another agent murdered him. There has to be someone who can take the fall for you.
Maybe... maybe the Chiss. No one trusts her. Can't believe it's come to this, but you're right. I don't have any choice.
Droid, hand over the supplies and provide coordinates to the prison annex turbolift. I've reprogrammed an astromech unit down there.
Find the astromech, deliver the supplies, and it will signal your contact. Logging off. Hope we see each other again....
The turbolift will take you directly to the prison annex. Goo--goo--good luck, Republic citizen.
You should co--co--coordinate with the rebellious workers in this facility. Good luck.
Combat sequence engaging, weapons arming.... War--war--warning: systems failure. Remote override prohibiting mayhem protocol activation.
Jedi target will be stored in memory, to be terminated at a future date.
Even the Empire's droids believe they're superior. Are you programmed for arrogance?
You're overconfident.
Negative. I am programmed to render you into component molecules.
It's polite of you to inform me of my imminent demise.
Thank you for the warning.
Settle your affairs, Republic scum. Your end is coming soon.
Republic Special Forces target will be stored in memory for later termination.
Pipe down, rust bucket. My combat droid's spare parts are bigger than you.
Good luck with that.
Spare parts provide insufficient cover against explosive attacks.
Target will be filed as "unidentified spacer" and cached in memory for future termination.
If you're planning to kill me, you should at least get my name right.
Let's get properly introduced.
Irrelevant. There will be no record of your passing. Your component organic parts will be recycled upon death.
Your target profile has been saved to memory for termination at a later date.
Attacking me would be foolish.
You lack a core combat processor. You overestimate your odds of survival.
I suggest you stop threatening my friend. Droids don't stand up well against lightsabers.
That won't be happening.
Your weapon is ineffective against high-yield explosives. If only I could trigger the one in my arsenal....
Perhaps you haven't noticed, but the Force is with your target. You should rethink your ambitions.
You're slightly outnumbered.
Your presence is noted, Jedi. I will terminate you first.
Mess with my friend and you mess with Havoc Squad. Got it?
You'll have to go through me.
I possess area-effect weaponry. Multiple targets should not pose any difficulty.
You planning to terminate all of us, or just my friend? Just wondering.
Does that include me, too?
I am capable of targeting multiple adversaries. There will be no delays when my terminations resume.
I was told you work for the Republic. Is that any way to greet an ally?
What a rude way to say hello.
Your information is incorrect. I am an Imperial assassination droid. My inability to carry out programmed functions is due to external interference.
I don't normally attack defenseless enemies, but I'll make an exception for you.
Prepare to be scrapped.
Engaging self-defense protocols... fai--fai--failure. Permanent deactivation imminent.
That's enough, droid. Vocabulator switched off....
Sorry about that. Had a little trouble overriding that stubborn droid's holo-emitter. I'm your contact. Republic SIS.
Wish I could meet you in person, but I'm at a comm station in the middle of Imperial Intelligence headquarters. Long story.
Are you insane? If they trace this signal, you're dead.
Get out of there.
My job is to maintain droids like this one. It's a perfect cover. Nobody's watching me... I think.
You can't drop a bomb like that and not give details. What are you doing in Imperial Intelligence?
I want to hear this.
As far as the enemy knows, I'm just an entry-level tech analyst. I'm trying to keep it that way.
We don't have time for stories. What's the mission?
Skip to the briefing.
My security access here is limited, but I've been able to coordinate with a resistance cell working inside the Imperial factory zone.
Those people are practically slaves. They're ready to revolt. They'll help you pinpoint critical Imperial targets. Stop the enemy before they can attack us.
All I need are their names and locations.
Let's get to work.
You're sure these workers aren't leading us into a trap?
Can we trust them?
You know how the Empire treats any species other than human. Believe me, they want us to win.
If the people down here were worth anything, they wouldn't be with the Empire.
These people are useless.
Most didn't realize what they were getting themselves into when they took the jobs. Give them a chance.
I'm uploading the profiles of people you should talk to. You'll find them nearby.
Uh-oh--gotta cut the channel. Good luck.
Vocabulator functions have re--re--resumed with limited language options. Have a caring day, Republic citizen.
My attack protocols have failed. Con--con--consider yourself lucky, Republic scum!
